channel.title: Professional Application Development With Revolution (now LiveCode) - Recent Lessons
channel.description: Recently created lessons from Professional Application Development With Revolution (now LiveCode)

item.title: Update FileStorm Project
item.description:
The FileStorm project uses an alias to the /Applications folder on your development computer. This alias adds an alias to the folder on the DMG file that is created so that the user can drag your application into the Applications directory really easily.

This lesson will show you how to create the alias and update the project to point to the alias.

item.title: Compiling Windows Installer
item.description: Let's look at how you compile the Windows installer using INNO Setup. You must have INNO Setup installed on Windows for this to work.

item.title: Building Installers With the Application Packager
item.description:
The Application Packager is what you use to package up your application in order to create an installer or provide an update.

In order to get around some limitations in regards to manipulating scripts that is present in a Revolution standalone application you need to open the Application Packager in the Revolution IDE. I usually keep multiple copies of the same version of Revolution around and just open the Application Packager stack in a separately running instance of the IDE.

item.title: Configure Global Build Profile Settings
item.description: We are just about ready to open the Application Packager. We just need to configure some settings that will affect building installers and update packages.

item.title: Add Read Me And Database As A Standalone Resource
item.description: Before using the Application Packager we are going to add two more files to the application. The Standalone Resources tab allows you to add files that will be included with the distribution for each platform.

item.title: Download Installer Programs
item.description:
In order to automate the creation of installers as much as possible you need the write software for creating installers. You want an installer program that creates installers based on text files or that can be automated through the use of a command line tool or AppleScript.

Here are suggestions for programs that I use on Windows and OS X. Download and install these programs if you would like to test building installers.

item.title: Filtering Files Using 'answer file with type'
item.description: Now we will use the file extension we just created to create a Filter for 'answer file with type'.

item.title: Defining Supported File Types
item.description: This chapter will show you how the GLX Application Framework helps you work with supported file extensions.

item.title: Slider & Field Example
item.description: Now we will look at a simple broadcasting example. Broadcasting is a way for controls to "sign-up" to receive messages when certain events occurs. In this example we will notify a field that the slider position of a scrollbar has changed.

item.title: Scrollbar Example
item.description: Now we will look at a similar undo example using a Scrollbar.

item.title: Text Field Example
item.description: Now let's look at how to undo changes to a field.

item.title: Creating Undo/Redo Buttons
item.description: Let's look at how to work with Undo.

item.title: Format General UI Controls For Platform
item.description: I created this To-Do application on a Mac. That means that if I set the text size or style of any controls that the current font was saved with the control. In this case Lucida Grande. The stack won't look very nice on Windows so we are going to look at an easy way to format controls to use the right font on each platform.

item.title: Broadcast Preference Change
item.description:
The To-Do application has two places in the UI that can change the value of the hide completed items preference. The first is the checkbox in the UI. The second is the Edit menu item. Let's look at a simple example that shows how Broadcasting can be used to keep the UI in sync when the preference value is changed by calling glxapp_setPref.

The framework uses the included Broadcasting API in order to send messages when preference values are changed. We will talk more about Broadcasting in Session III.

item.title: Make State of "Hide Complete Items" Checkbox a Preference
item.description: Now we are going to add a preference to the application.

item.title: Test Loading of Libraries
item.description: Now that you have configured the application to load the new libraries.rev stack file at launch you can open the application in the IDE again to test.

item.title: Add libControlFormatter.rev
item.description: Now that you have a location to store libraries you are going to add a new library to the libraries stack.

item.title: Create libraries.rev Stack File
item.description: Now you will create a libraries.rev stack file. This stack file is a good place to store libraries that your application uses. The libraries can be substacks of the libraries.rev mainstack.

item.title: Open To-Do Application
item.description: Your homework for this session involves adding some features to an existing application. The application is a variant of the SQL Yoga To-Do application.

item.title: Download cacert.pem File
item.description:
When working with SSL you need to provide Revolution with a certificate file so it can verify that the host is who it says it is. You can download a cert file here:

http://curl.haxx.se/docs/caextract.html

You include this file in your application files and set the sslcertificates property to the path to the file.
